abstract.text: Information about a product that you configure in App Store Connect.

legalNotices.copyright: Copyright © 2025 Apple Inc. All rights reserved.

inlineContent.text: The
type represents the in-app purchases that you configure in App Store Connect and make available for purchase within your app. Use
to perform all product-related tasks in your app, from displaying in-app purchases and offers to making a purchase and getting transaction and subscription status information.
To get a
instance, call
and provide one or more in-app purchase product identifiers. Use a
instance to display in-app purchases and subscription offers in your store, as follows:
Show the localized name, description, and pricing information using
, and
, respectively.
Determine whether a user is eligible for an introductory offer for the product using
Display your subscription offers using the subscription information in
When users initiate a purchase, call
or
on the product instance. If your app uses SwiftUI, you can also use
. Set purchase options (

) to define an optional app account token, apply a promotional offer, or set a product quantity. Purchase options can also simulate an Ask to Buy scenario when youâ€™re testing your app in the sandbox environment.
Use a
instance to learn whether a user is entitled to a product by checking
, which holds the transaction that entitles the user to the product. This transaction information, as well as the transaction in
, are cryptographically signed by the App Store in JSON Web Signature (JWS) format.
If the product is an auto-renewable subscription, use the
and
in the
information to help manage subscriptions and inform business decisions, such as presenting subscription offers.
For information about configuring In-App Purchases in App Store Connect, see

abstract.text: Support In-App Purchases and interactions with the App Store.
Information about a product that you configure in App Store Connect.
The state of a task that loads a collection of products in the background.
The types of in-app purchases.
Information about a promoted In-App Purchase that customizes its order and visibility on the device.
Error information for product purchase errors.
Optional settings for a product purchase that add account information, purchase details, and offers, or that specify behaviors.
The result of a purchase.
Information about an auto-renewable subscription, such as its status, period, subscription group, and subscription offer details.
The renewal status information for an auto-renewable subscription.
The signed renewal information for the auto-renewable subscription.
A Boolean value that indicates whether the customer is eligible for an introductory offer.
An array that contains status information for a subscription group, including renewal and transaction information.
Information about a subscription offer that you configure in App Store Connect.
Values that represent the duration of time between subscription renewals.
The state of a task that loads a product in the background.
The transaction that entitles the user to the product.
The localized description of the product.
The localized display name of the product, if it exists.
The localized string representation of the product price, suitable for display.
The unique product identifier.
A Boolean value that indicates whether the product is available for Family Sharing in App Store Connect.
The JSON representation of the product information.
The most recent transaction for the product.
The decimal representation of the cost of the product, in local currency.
The format style for the numbers in the price of the product.
Requests product data from the App Store.
Processes a purchase for the product.
Initiates a purchase for the product with the App Store and displays the confirmation sheet.
Processes a purchase for the product.
Initiates a purchase for the product with the App Store and displays the confirmation sheet.
The subscription information for an auto-renewable subscripton.
The format style for the date components related to a subscriptionâ€™s duration.
The format style for subscription period units, such as week, month, or year.
The in-app purchase product type.
An action that starts an In-App Purchase.
Information about an auto-renewable subscription.
Represents the renewal status information for an auto-renewable subscription.
Offer In-App Purchases and manage entitlements using signed transactions and status information.

abstract.text: Provide service to share subscriptions and non-consumable products to family members.

abstract.text: Display promoted In-App Purchases on your product page and handle purchases that users initiate on the App Store.

abstract.text: A type that can be hashed into a `Hasher` to produce an integer hash value.
A type that can be compared for value equality.
A class of types whose instances hold the value of an entity with stable identity.
A type with a customized textual representation suitable for debugging purposes.
A type whose values can be implicitly or explicitly copied.
A thread-safe type whose values can be shared across arbitrary concurrent contexts without introducing a risk of data races.
